alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 19 at 5:59PM CDT until April 19 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN GRADY...SOUTHWESTERN OKLAHOMA...NORTHWESTERN CLEVELAND AND NORTHWESTERN MCCLAIN COUNTIES... At 559 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Newcastle, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported over 2 inch hail near Bridge Creek. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southern Oklahoma City, northwestern Norman, Moore, Newcastle, Blanchard, Tuttle, Valley Brook, Bridge Creek, and Stanley Draper Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
